result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. DONALD E JOHNSON

records.addlTxt:
9:36 AM Defendant DONALD E JOHNSON in court.  Attorney Erika Amundson in court for DONALD E JOHNSON.  Prosecuting attorney Wade Newell in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Updated offer needed, FIT is no a good option.
Bond continued.
Review hearing scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 09:15 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
BOND COVERS 22CF524 & 21CF823
Defendant is ordered to report to pretrial monitoring immediately after court and must comply with pretrial monitoring conditions.
Not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs.
Defendant shall not go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.
Defendant shall not drive without a valid driver's license.
Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
Not to possess syringes unless medically required.
Daily PBTs at CHSO or Soberlink device.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
Bond in 21CF823 to cover 22CF524.
Court orders defendant to sign bond at the Clerk of Courts.

9:47 AM Defendant DONALD E JOHNSON in court.  Attorney Erika Amundson in court for DONALD E JOHNSON.  Prosecuting attorney Sara Matthews in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Attorney waives reading of complaint in 22CF524. 
Defendant is informed of charges. 
Defendant received copy of Criminal Complaint. 
Court appoints Attorney Amundson on file 22CF524.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 09:45 am.
Review hearing scheduled for October 18, 2022 at 09:30 am.
